channel.title: NPR Topics: Space
channel.description: NPR coverage of space exploration, space shuttle missions, news from NASA, private space exploration, satellite technology, and new discoveries in astronomy and astrophysics.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: NASA astronauts celebrate Thanksgiving with Russian cranberry sauce
item.description: NASA has made sure that the International Space Station is well stocked for a Thanksgiving meal full of treats. Here's what's on the menu.
item.content:encoded:
NASA has made sure that the International Space Station is well stocked for a Thanksgiving meal full of treats. Here's what's on the menu.

(Image credit: NASA webcast)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: China launches Shenzhou 22 spacecraft to assist in return of 3 stranded astronauts
item.description: China has launched the Shenzhou 22 spacecraft to help bring back a team of astronauts after a damaged spacecraft left them temporarily stranded on China's Tiangong space station.
item.content:encoded:
China has launched the Shenzhou 22 spacecraft to help bring back a team of astronauts after a damaged spacecraft left them temporarily stranded on China's Tiangong space station.

(Image credit: Lian Zhen)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Comet 3I/Atlas doesn't need to be 'alien' to deserve a closer look, scientists say
item.description: There's a new celebrity in town and it's... a comet. Much of the attention has to do with an astrophysicist's grandiose suggestions that 3I/ATLAS could contain alien life. Other scientists disagree.
item.content:encoded: There's a new celebrity in town and it's... a comet. Much of the attention has to do with an astrophysicist's grandiose suggestions that 3I/ATLAS could contain alien life. Other scientists disagree.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: China's astronauts land safely after space debris collision
item.description: Three Chinese astronauts are back on earth after they had to prolong their stay in outer space due to space debris hitting their spacecraft.
item.content:encoded: Three Chinese astronauts are back on earth after they had to prolong their stay in outer space due to space debris hitting their spacecraft.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: PBS documentary looks at 25 years of the challenges of surviving in space on the ISS
item.description: This year is the 25th anniversary of humans inhabiting the International Space Station. A new PBS documentary looks at how the ISS was built and the challenges of surviving in outer space.
item.content:encoded: This year is the 25th anniversary of humans inhabiting the International Space Station. A new PBS documentary looks at how the ISS was built and the challenges of surviving in outer space.
item.dc:creator: Jeanette Woods

item.title: Space forecasters say severe solar storms could hit Earth and trigger auroras
item.description: The sun has burped out bursts of energy called coronal mass ejections that could reach Earth Tuesday night. Forecasters said the vibrant displays could be visible across much of the northern U.S.
item.content:encoded:
The sun has burped out bursts of energy called coronal mass ejections that could reach Earth Tuesday night. Forecasters said the vibrant displays could be visible across much of the northern U.S.

(Image credit: Charlie Riedel)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Funding for space missions hang in the balance with the government shutdown
item.description: Planetary science is in limbo during the government shutdown — things like analyzing asteroids, studying the magnetosphere of Jupiter, or better understanding Mars so that humans might one day visit.
item.content:encoded: Planetary science is in limbo during the government shutdown — things like analyzing asteroids, studying the magnetosphere of Jupiter, or better understanding Mars so that humans might one day visit.
item.dc:creator: Katia Riddle

item.title: Trump once again nominates tech space traveler Jared Isaacman to serve as NASA administrator
item.description: President Donald Trump announced Tuesday he has decided to nominate Jared Isaacman to serve as his NASA administrator, months after withdrawing the tech billionaire's nomination because of concerns about his political leanings.
item.content:encoded:
President Donald Trump announced Tuesday he has decided to nominate Jared Isaacman to serve as his NASA administrator, months after withdrawing the tech billionaire's nomination because of concerns about his political leanings.

(Image credit: John Raoux)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Why an interstellar comet has scientists excited
item.description: The comet could be older than our solar system. The comet is also distinct because nickel vapor was detected in the gas surrounding it.
item.content:encoded:
The comet could be older than our solar system. The comet is also distinct because nickel vapor was detected in the gas surrounding it.

(Image credit: NASA)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Time for an interstellar flyby! Meet 3i/ATLAS, a very old comet
item.description: Scientists are observing the skies as the comet 3i/ATLAS makes a close flyby of Earth.
item.content:encoded: Scientists are observing the skies as the comet 3i/ATLAS makes a close flyby of Earth.
item.dc:creator: Gabriel J. Sánchez
